text:
make distclean does not remove all files created by configure && make.  i found
the following files still in the source tree afterwards:

os/os2/Makefile
os/beos/Makefile
os/os2/.deps
os/beos/.deps
shlibtool
srclib/apr-util/include/apr_ldap.h
srclib/apr-util/config.nice
srclib/apr/config.nice
config.nice

i did search for this issue in bugzilla, on google, the users list, but could
not find an earlier report. sorry if already known.

thanks for apache,
karl
creator: karl@freefriends.org

text:
Most of those look like they should be removed, yes.  But for the record, the 
config.nice files are left behind intentionally and will remain so, given that 
the last time someone proposed that they be removed, removing them was vetoed 
by both myself and Greg Stein.
creator: jwoolley@apache.org

text:
Far be it from me to argue, but fyi, in every other package I'm aware of, the
purpose of make distclean is to restore the source directory to the state of the
initial distribution, i.e., after the tar xzf.

Whatever, no big deal.  Thanks for the reply.
creator: karl@freefriends.org
jerenkrantz@apache.org
text:
Fixed in HEAD of httpd-2.0 (Makefile.in r1.129, configure.in r1.243) and apr-util (Makefile.in r1.76).

Thanks for using Apache HTTP Server!
